Introduction.paragraph1: Hello there, I'm Jim from Taiwan, a person deeply passionate about Geographic Information Science (GIS) and remote sensing technology, actively exploring and contributing to this field. Holding both a Master's and Bachelor's degree in Geography from National Taiwan Normal University.
Introduction.paragraph2: As a research assistant, I engaged in various projects, from air quality prediction to the development of geospatial applications. At China Credit Information Service, I served as a researcher and full-stack developer, working on automating appraisal processes by merging geospatial technology with internal algorithms.

About.Title: I'm Jim. I live in Tapei, where I devote myself to the field of
About.intro: Wsp! Thanks for stopping by. I’m Jim, a dedicated and experienced GIS professional eager to continue exploring and contributing to Geographic Information Science in my future endeavors. Some highlights about me and my activities:
About.highlight_content_0: Member of National Taiwan Normal University, FORMOSAT-2 Image Application Distribute Center (IADC)
About.highlight_content_1: System developer at <guidelines>China Credit Information Service Ltd (CCIS)</guidelines> in Taipei.
About.highlight_content_2: Part-time remote developer at <guidelines>JRShen Digital Culture (JSDC)</guidelines>

Publications.Title: I actively pursued opportunities to share my findings with the academic community.
Publications.Description: These are several of my publications, including conference, journal paper, and conference presentations. Even though this isn't much, everyone starts somewhere, right?

Articles.Title: I also enjoy writing articles and sharing my thoughts on various topics.
Articles.Description: Here are some of my articles, which cover a wide range of topics, from GIS technology to journal paper review.
